description.narrative: National institutions in charge of child protection and civil registration have increased capacity to plan and implement policies and laws with improved coordination and information management.

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems
Legal and policy framework related to child marriage

Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National institutions in charge of child protection and civil registration have increased capacity to plan and implement policies and laws with improved coordination and information management.

description.narrative: Government's commitment to ending child marriage translated through the implementation of a budgeted strategic national action plan (2019-2021), with the support of the UNFPA-UNICEF Joint Global Program to Accelerate Action to End Child Marriage, the spotlight initiative. The new civil registration policy and law was adopted by the parliament contributing to the achievement of the universal birth registration. The system of data collection was reinforced through the review and validation of child protection indicators. Thanks to the pilot of CPIMS , a model of information management was developed including harmonized tools and procedures | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of Legislation / Regulations Developed or Revised
An alternative care policy in line with the 2009 Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children is available in the country

Country has a functioning, national, multi-sectoral, multi-stakeholder coordination mechanism tasked with overseeing national plans or strategies to prevent and respond to violence against children and adolescents, with child and adolescent participation.
Country has an inter-operable information management system supports and tracks case management, incident monitoring, and programme monitoring (all, including humanitarian)
Country implementing a costed national action plan or strategy to end child marriage.
Country routinely collects and publishes key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex.
Country has an interoperable service delivery with Health
